intro: Moraea flavescens, commonly known as the yellow moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive orange center. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, sturdy stem. Moraea flavescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
